review: Great until it sleeps.  When it sleeps, it creates an error with my TV's HDCP connection.  Each time the fire stick sleeps I have to unplug my tv and the firestick and then restart them both.  Turning sleep off is not an option in the settings which it should be, and if it was an option then i would give it 5 stars, but since it isn't it creates a huge pain every time i want to use it.  So now I will just stop using it.

review: We have the ROKU and the Fire TV stick and hands down, our favorite is the stick. We ordered the stick before it was officially released and we couldn't be happier with the price we paid.Games, Prime content, purchased content, channels (Netflix, etc) - it's all there and we use it regularly. I can quickly browse our library, search, or browse content and I'm impressed with how much material they have for both the kids and the adults.Every so often (after many weeks), we have to unplug the power source and let it sit so that it resets. I see that this has been mentioned, but ours is nowhere near every 3 days like I've read here.One suggestion for improvement: headphones in the remote.

review: After researching the different streaming devices, I decided to go with Amazon FireTV.  This is my first one ever.  I originally planned to get the box, but bought my dad the stick as a gift, which he didn't want.  Anyway, I am using the stick myself and find that it is fast enough for me.  My main goal was to be able to get youtube on my tv, which I can do with the firetv.  I have cable hookeup and most everything streams without buffering.  There may be some buffering once in a while, but not much.  I don't like not having a manual on how to do things, but when I did call amazon, they did help me on one issue.  I also don't like how youtube placed inappropriate videos on my "history", when I didn't even view them.  I had to set the "control".  This is probably the only reason why I didn't give it five stars.  Also, there are not many "free" movies on Amazon Prime Videos.  I like Glen Ford and there are only three free ones.  All others you have to rent or buy.  I know this has nothing to do with the firetv, but just worth mentioning.  This is also the case for many other actors.  HBOGO is also available on the firetv.  In time I may also purchase the firetv box.
